summary.title: GAME2016 L12 - Collision Detection.pdf
summary.overview: Lecture: L12 - Collision Detection. This lecture covers the following key concepts: - Animation typically involves interpolation, keyframe and easing. - Collision typically involves AABB, sphere and ray-casting. - Vector typically involves magnitude, direction and component. - Rotation typically involves quaternion, euler angles and axis-angle. - Numerical Values is an important concept in this lecture. Students should be able to explain these concepts and apply them to simple problems and examples.
applications:
▪Applied to lots of objects, often in real -time 
applications

[Page 22]
GAME2016 Mathematical Foundation of Game Design and Animation

[Page 23]
Spheres in Collision Detection
▪A bounding sphere is often used in collision 
detection for fast rejection because the equations 
for intersection with a sphere are simple

▪A bounding sphere can be used for an object 
regardless of the orientation of the object

Expanding this, if p= [ x y z ]:
(x–cx)2+ (y–cy)2= r2(2D circle )
(x–cx)2+ (y–cy)2+ (z–cz)2= r2(3D sphere )
